newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia late palm olein easier, interest thin.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia late palm olein easier, interest thin.

text.p: Indonesian palm olein prices were easier in late trading on Monday, with sharp declines in Malaysia weighing on the already weak sentiment.
Traders said palm olein was quoted at 1,360-65 rupiah/kg in Jakarta, against 1,365-70 rupiah at the opening, but trades were also heard at five rupiah below and above the level.

"It was another slow day today," one trader said. "Demand was very thin, due mostly to the sharp falls in Malaysia after the export numbers came out." Cargo surveyor Societe Generale de Surveillance (SGS) put Malaysian June palm oil exports at 611,368 tonnes against 672,805 tonnes in May.
"I think prices will remain weak through the week," another trader said. "Buyers are not keen on taking positions because of the weakening of prices in Malaysia.
"They are anticipating further declines and will move in when prices start picking up," he added.
Data from Belawan Port showed that the MT Jo Birk will leave the North Sumatran port on Monday for Dumai with 22,000 tonnes of palm oil.
